entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A zeolite mineral with a molecular structure similar to chabazite, usually found in weathered volcanic ash.
examples: The dust clouds for both the erionite and crocidolite exposures containing 10mg/ m−3[sic] of dust, which produce fibre levels of 354 fibre cm−3 and 1630 fibre cm−3 > 5 µm in length, respectively. The erionite cloud contained fewer fibres and more equant particles.
